snippet: Jenaii van Doten, the mother of Alphonza Bryant III, a 17-year-old who was killed last month in the Bronx, said the police had cursed at him during a recent street stop.
abstract: Teenager Alphonza Bryant III was killed on a Bronx street corner in April in what police officials describe as a case of mistaken identity stemming from a gang dispute; Bryant's mother Jenail van Doten, says in an interview that her son was recently mistreated by New York City police during a stop-and-frisk encounter, and urges city officials to modify police tactics to create bond between department and community.

byline.contributor: Nate Schweber, David W. Chen and Joseph Goldstein contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Jenaii van Doten, the mother of Alphonza Bryant III, a 17-year-old who was killed last month in the Bronx, said the police had cursed at him during a recent street stop.

headline.seo: Before Alphonza Bryant’s Death, an Unpleasant Police Run-In, Mother Says
headline.main: Grieving Mother Tells of Her Son’s Unpleasant Police Stop
